meanings.definition: A curved structure that supports weight over an open space.
meanings.sent1: The old stone arch stood strong over the river.
meanings.sent2: The architect designed a beautiful arch for the entrance.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel ran along the arch of the fence.
meanings.sent4: Her smile formed an arch of happiness across her face.
meanings.sent5: The rainbow formed a perfect arch in the sky after the rain.

meanings.definition: To form or make an arch shape.
meanings.sent1: She tried to arch her back to touch her toes.
meanings.sent2: The cat arched its back in fear.
meanings.sent3: He arched his eyebrows in surprise at the news.
meanings.sent4: The bridge arched gracefully over the flowing river.
meanings.sent5: The gymnast could arch her body into a perfect circle.

meanings.sent1: The arch fox outsmarted the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent2: Her arch smile hinted at a secret joke.
meanings.sent3: The arch kitten played with a ball of yarn.
meanings.sent4: His arch comment made everyone laugh at the party.
meanings.sent5: The arch student always had a clever solution to every problem.
